column1: #Text=Officers reprimanded for crashing British nuclear sub
#Text=A British Royal Navy commander was reprimanded on Monday by a court martial , after pleading guilty to " failing to ensure the safe direction " of the submarine HMS Superb .
#Text=Commander Steven Drysdale was in charge of the nuclear-powered submarine in May 2008 , when it struck a rock pinnacle 132 metres below the surface .
#Text=A navigation chart showed the pinnacle , but Drysdale said that he had misread its depth as 732 metres .

#Text=Officer of the Watch Lieutenant-Commander Andrew Cutler and Navigating Officer Lieutenant Lee Blair were also reprimanded for their part in the incident by the court martial , held at the HMS Nelson centre at Portsmouth naval base .
#Text=The three defendants all looked at the chart and the sub was taken to 250m .
#Text=No thorough check was made to establish whether this depth was safe from obstacles .
#Text=The £32 million submarine was in the Red Sea , heading for the Persian Gulf , and was suffering from technical problems at the time which were slowing it down .
#Text=The officers decided to dive from 100m to 250m , which would allow them to travel faster and reach their destination on time .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Lieutenant-Commander Cutler then realised that a change to the route could shorten it . “ On assessing the chart , Officer of the Watch Cutler saw he could cut the corner of a dog-leg , saving about three to four miles ,  said Crozier .

#Text= He then instructed the plot officer to draw a new line on the chart .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Unfortunately , with the sub now dived to 250m , this new track went directly over a pinnacle which showed only 132m of available depth .

_	_	_	_

#Text=The new route was plotted directly over the pinnacle on the chart , and the court martial was told that this made it harder to spot the error .

#Text=Commander Alison Towler , representing Drysdale , said that he accepted full responsibility and had  deep remorse and regret " over the incident .

column1: #Text=" He believes that due to the surrounding information he simply misread 132m as 732m " she said .
#Text=" It was only later that he realised the plot officer had drawn the sub ’s new transit straight through the pinnacle , which made it even harder for it to be seen .
